Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2012 09:53PM JeniferMiya wrote: Hi mgdsmc,  With DCIS and LCIS the IS is In Situ, non-invasive. The cancer has not spread outside of the duct or other tissues.  I had an MRI October 5th to see if it has spread elsewhere, since I would like to save the lymph nodes on my left. For the right side I'm having the sentinel lymph nodes removed.  I meet with my BS on the 22nd to go over everything for the surgery.  I would have liked to meet with her sooner rather than 3 days before. I feel like I need more time than 3 days to prepare! As for coping, I had my mammo/ultrasound on October 18th, was told to return on the 21st for biopsies, one of them being my lymph node.  On the 26th I got the call that it was cancer. For about 5 days I spent my nights in my room upset, wondering how many more times will I hug my kids, scold them for bad grades, ask them to clean their rooms, tell them I love them etc...I kept telling myself to stop thinking that way.  I got up to grab a tissue and looked at myself, more specifically my boob and just got angry and started yelling at it. Well, it was more of a whispering yell with my teeth clenched so my kids wouldn't hear me. It went a little like this (pardon my sailor mouth) F-YOU CANCER, F-YOU. I HAVE A LIFE TO LIVE AND YOU'RE NOT A PART OF IT. I HAVE KIDS TO RAISE AND A LIFE TO LIVE. I'M GONNA KICK YOUR ASS!   I've done that a few times and it feels pretty damn good.  However today was a crappy day, just felt so darn emotional. Tomorrow will be a great day! Well, it better be or I'm gonna have to grit my teeth and yell at that cancer again!... Ladies, thank you so much for being here! Hugs & Kisses
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 10, 2012 10:09PM JeniferMiya wrote: Maryah930   Thank you for sharing.  It's healthier to vent rather than holding it in...  Yesterday was an emotional day for me. Not all day just random moments, like you.  If we didn't have emotions, we'd all be zombies... You are a strong beautiful woman with an awesome husband, great family and friends who support you!  We're on the right side of the grass and that's all that matters! -hugs

Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2012 10:14PM JeniferMiya wrote: Has anyone else experienced a "fever" in the area of the cancer?... I've had it on and off but tonight it's much worse.. Very warm to the touch and experiencing pain as well...  Almost like an infection, festering and growing. I know the area feels much different in size from when I first found it to a few weeks ago to right now. It feels much larger, even my friends have noticed a difference in size.  I'm glad to hear everyone seems to be doing well.  If I don't pop on here before going in for surgery on the 25th, I'm sending positive messages into the universe for everyone having procedures this week. As for the "Pinktober" All I've bought was a fight like a girl tumbler.  It was too cute to pass up... I've been making "survival" bracelets out of paracord.  I'm trying to make a few dollars since I've been unemployed and it's unlikely to get hired anywhere while starting this process..
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 22, 2012 08:48PM JeniferMiya wrote: Wendymartha1  Too bad I'm not up there or you down here.  Looks like we've got the same schedule across the board.  Going over pre-op with the hospital tomorrow, dye injection for SNB on Weds and surgery on Thursday.  Found out today that they will be doing the SN on both sides now, not just the right side. As for people discussing my condition, I beat them all to it.  I notified my immediate family then two close friends and then just posted the news on FB instead of having to explain things when running into everyone else in public.  And I'm not sure about anyone else but I'm sick and tired of people's responses saying, I'm so sorry....  I just respond with, Why? You didn't do this to me... And end up telling them to be positive and that I'll be fine... There should a BC Etiquette Book so people know how to handle us WARRIORS! Glad to hear everyone seems to be doing well. Positive thoughts and messages into the Universe for all of us. -Hugs
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2012 09:23AM JeniferMiya wrote: I'm back ladies .. I had a bunch of "catching up" to do on here!... 16 days post op on my BMX. Seems like a bunch of us have/had the C word in our Right breasts.. I'm going to quote my path report on my result. "F. BREAST (RIGHT), MASTECTOMY:      -INVASIVE DUCTAL CARCINOMA, GRADE III, ARISING IN A FIELD OF HIGH GRADE DUCTAL CARCINOMA IN-SITU  WITH COMEDO NECROSIS." (I knew this was a big one but was  shocked at just how big, the DCIS was 8x8x5cm and the IDC which we didn't know was there was 1.3x0.7cm) "G. RIGHT AXILLARY SENTINEL LYMPH NODE#1:      -TWO (2) LYMPH NODES, ONE (1) POSITIVE FOR METASTATIC ADENOCARCINOMA" (myoriginal biopsy, the results were negative for cancer) They took 9 lymph nodes on the right and 5 on the left... I wasn't prepared when my BS gave me the results and saying that I will have to do chemo. Now just waiting on the HER2 results to see if I'm doing 4 or 6 rounds of chemo. As for healing... With soap dispensers, I just put it closer on the counter instead of reaching and using both hands to pump helps a ton.. Before I left the hospital, there are a group of survivors who put together gift bags which included a hand made drain holder with 2 pockets and ties around the waist like a little apron (very cute) they also make heart shaped pillows which I've kept with me at all times. They are perfect for the seatbelt, fit right under your arms etc... I have to say they are the best gifts I've ever received (aside from stuff my kids made!) Absolute life savers and so comforting.  I've been working on my "wall crawls" to stretch my arms but every morning is like groundhog day.. It's the worst part of the day, wake up sore and stiff. But once I'm up and move around it's not too bad.  Going in for my first fill next Tuesday... First drain was out on the 1st and the other drain came out on the 6th (thank God I only had 2) I'm about to make a quick drive to the school for the first time.  I've been lucky enough to stay at my Dads for the past couple of weeks.  I gotta say he and my kids have been AWESOME!.. Ok, I gotta run.. Stay strong Dolls, xoxoxox
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2012 07:26AM JeniferMiya wrote: Hello Ladies, I'm new to this too.. I posted in another section before coming across this post... I'm still trying to figure out the abreviations.. Like BMX, I keep thinking of the bike... I'm scheduled for mastectomy on October 25 and expanders will be put into place.. I don't meet with my surgeon until the 22nd and I have tons of questions.  For instance, I thought I'd be doing some sort of same day surgery but then I'm reading about hospital stays and drains etc...  Like most of you, this is happening pretty fast.  I was diagnosed DCIS stage 0 grade 3 (5cm+) This bad boy popped up quick.  I went for a Depo shot end of May (boobs were fine) begininng of July my son gave me a bear hug and I felt a sharp pain and I felt this huge mass. As a single parent, I have been very open with my 2 kids about all of this.  Yesterday my son (13) says, Does this mean we don't have to shop at Victoria's Secret anymore?.. Told him I still need panties! So here I am.  I am opting for the double mastectomy.  I'd rather they both go at the same time instead of looking in the mirror at one "good" boob. They are taking the sentinel lymph nodes as well on the right.. I'm keeping my sense of humor with all of this rather than mope.  I'd rather people joke around with me and keep things light hearted.  We have a Breast Cancer walk on the 20th  So I'm making the most of my last weekend with my boobs, sending them off with a bang!
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Nov 13, 2012 07:28PM JeniferMiya wrote: Happy Birthday Paula!  The results are back. Triple positive. 6 rounds of chemo it is. I'll be getting a mediport "installed"  It's going to be a busy week and a half.  On the 15th is an echocardiogram appt. before the 20th I need to do the mediport consult with radiology.  On the 20th pet scan and a fill. After the 20th mediport installation and then I'll start chemo. Out of curiosity, my oncologist said for me to be prepared to lose hair on day 18.  Has anyone else been told that? Oh, got my first fill today, 25cc's each.  About the nipple recon.  My PS said it would be done after the implant procedure has healed up.  Sounds like there are a few ways PS's approach this. I'm happy everyone sounds good.. -hugs to you all!
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2012 12:22AM JeniferMiya wrote: Hi ladies... It's taken me a couple of nights to get through the posts since I didn't have the energy to pop on in a week.  I would read a couple of pages then doze off, so I'm finally caught up.. Most of you sound like you've done ok with pain and such. Where to begin.. Started chemo on the 27th, had 2 "good days" until it hit me. I was down, worse than a man complaining about having the flu.On day 3 my joints were in such pain. I tried a claritin but that did absolutely nothing. The pain lasted for 4 days, hardly slept then on day 5 the only way for me to describe it is.. It felt like all of my organs were throbbing. I almost went to the ER, it scared me so bad. I tried calling the MO but the nurse didn't return the call. Went in this past Tuesday for blood work (finally feeling better) everything came back normal, thank God!... Had anyone else experienced the throbbing sensations?.. Still haven't noticed any additional hairloss yet. If anything it seems like the last 2 washes that less hair has come out than normal.  I feel a little sensitivitybut that's about it. As I type this I can feel myself about to nod off again.. Going to try and finish this before I do though.. Another quick vent... Mom took me to my appointment and on the way home she says.. "See, so now you know how I feel after having my radiation for my thyroid." (1 round of radiation last year) She continues to tell me that no one came to visit her (mind you, she told us she had to be confined for 3 days) and at no point did I say anything about people visiting me... I didn't want anyone around feeling the way I was.  Why she keeps trying to compare and "know" what I'm going thru just trips me out. I'm sorry if that didn't make much sense, I keep nodding off.. I'm so thankful for you ladies. I really wish we had some sort of video chat for all of us to chat on...  Mama LuvBugs, a big hug would be awesome. Hugs to you all and may tomorrow be better than today.  Good night dolls
Posts.Title: Starting chemo November 2012 michellej1980 IamNancy

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2012 10:19PM JeniferMiya wrote: Michelle- Thank you for your original post which has brought all of us together! Eleni- As for sex, I have no significant other so BOB it is... I have to say, it was good stress relief.  It took my mind off of all of this crap. (at least for a few minutes) My last post was a couple of days ago and at that point had not lost hair.... Apparently I had spoken too soon.. Right after posting (day 12) suddenly it was coming out by the handfuls. I just kept finger combing my hair and lost about half of it that day. By that night I put it into a pony tail and had my daughter cut it off.  Next day, I lost a ton more.  Today, I've only got about 25% of it left, if that.  To compensate for the hair loss, I've gone heavier on the eye makeup and dolling myself up that way instead.  If there is such thing as a "good" side effect from chemo, I'd say it has to be this Brazillian I've got going on downstairs! Or shall I call it the chemzillian?  Hugs to all of you

Posts.Title: Starting chemo November 2012 michellej1980 IamNancy

Posts.Content: Nov 22, 2012 04:07PM JeniferMiya wrote: I had a lot of catching up to do!.. My attention span is short and all over the place so please forgive me if I forget to mention a name in regards to previous posts.. Soteria, Dakota & 5luvbugs- Thank you for the posts the other day! Wendy- I'm "happy" to see you here Thankful- Give your daughter a fist bump for me, she sounds like an awesome young lady! I feel the same as you. The BMX was "nothing" compared to what's about to happen with my hair. I have always been a hair twirler, my friends even joke about it! In regards to hair loss, I've always lost "gobs" of hair on a regular basis.  Even when my aunt helped wash my hair after the BMX she was shocked at the amount of hair I lose daily.. Now it's time to vent... My mom has been gone for a 3 month "vacation" in Japan visiting friends and family. Just after she left is when I went for the mammo/ultrasounds, biopsies, diagnosis and then bmx... Everyone but me seemed to be pissed that she didn't cut her trip short to be with daughter.. Her only contact with me was an occasional email which were very short.  So finally we are at the airport to pick her up and as she walked up I broke down and started to cry (overwhelmed with everything) All she said was, you'll be fine, don't worry.. then as we walked towards the escalator she says to me.. "Well I've always been an A cup until I gained all of this weight, so I know what that's like." (she's been like a C/D cup for the last 15 years)... I just ignored her.  I think I was hoping that she would come back a "changed" person but that didn't happen... In my last email, I asked if we could have a quiet Thanksgiving since she always invites her friends over... Her response in that email was.. Well I invited them several months ago, I'm not going to just cancel on them. (I'm sure they would have understood considering the circumstances) So here I am on the couch all snotty nosed and teary eyed since I wasn't up for being around a bunch of people who would be asking questions and how am I's and so on.. Plus all of the bandages would have just added to the effect.  Then to top it off, I've got my sliding glass door open since it's beautiful out. Meanwhile, my neighbors have family over and one of them is on the phone out back and begins to talk smack about my lanai which is very bare and a little dirty (the potted plumeria tree had fallen over and spilled mulch so I put the pot upright but I haven't been up to sweeping the mulch up yet) ... You gotta be effin kidding me?! I wanted to go out there and tell her off. Ok, it's off my chest. Thank you for letting me vent (sigh) I feel a little better, now only if a good ice cream joint were open! Hugs everyone, Happy Thanksgiving.  We are on the right side of the grass and that's what matters!
Posts.Title: Starting chemo November 2012 michellej1980 IamNancy

Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2012 10:25PM JeniferMiya wrote: Eleni- You're right, EFF it!  Thank you all, it helps me not feel so alone... I love these pep talks we have. I know I read someone asking about the EMLA cream.. I had gone to the pharmacy to pick up my moms meds (go figure) and there was a script waiting for me from the Onc. It was my EMLA cream and Zofran.  If you put the EMLA cream on, apply it thicker. Like icing a cake just not as thick and cover with saran wrap. As for the port placement, I was awake just under a light anesthesia, I was even talking and joking around but I do that all the time. The pressure from the bandages were very uncomfortable especially when I would laugh, sneeze or cough but I took them off today and it feels better.  Although I don't know what this "dried glue" type of stuff is and I'm afraid to peel it off.  So I'll just leave it for now.  I go in for port education on Monday.  Was supposed to have a pet scan the other day but insurance won't cover it. Then was told I would be doing a ct scan but never heard back from the office so I suppose I'll find out on Monday. I did pick up an inexpensive ($32) wig today (on a whim) It's not as bad as I thought it would be... Ladies, we can become every fantasy! Blonde, Brunette, Red, Pink, Purple! We may have been forced into this club but now it's our turn to show BC who's the BAWSE! Hugs & fist bumps everyone

Posts.Content: Dec 15, 2012 12:43AM JeniferMiya wrote: Hi "Mom"... I'm doing pretty good.  Lost about 95% of my hair in a few days so I went to the barber shop where the woman who does my sons hair is a 5 year survivor and I asked for her to have the honors and and shaved the last remaining bit off... Not as bad as I thought but not sure I'm brave enough to strut in public without a hat. Maychen- It sucks to hear about the cancer but I believe in you and know you're gonna whoop some cancer ass! (((hugs))) The duct tape method sounds like a great idea, I may give it a try.  All of these buzzed hairs are kinda gross when I see them on my sheets/pillows.  Reminds me of little pubes, eww.... (sorry for being kinda graphic) Ladies, you are in my thoughts and prayers.

Posts.Content: Nov 22, 2012 04:14PM JeniferMiya wrote: @ Thankful, I felt my boobs up when I was in for my birthcontrol shot at the end of May. (no lumps) Then in the begininng of July my son  gave me a bear hug and I felt this pain in my right breast so I went into the bathroom and felt this "large" lump.  Felt different from the little pea sized things I've felt in the past. This was irregular in shape and felt to be around 2cm. Got in for the mammo/ultrasound late Sept. October 1st. went to the breast surgeon and she confirmed I had DCIS and it felt to be about 5cm.  (yes, I could feel it getting bigger as time went on) Was only supposed to be a BMX then the post op reports showed IDC and 1 node positive. So chemo it is.

Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2012 08:54PM JeniferMiya wrote: Wendy, I just picked up a great cook book by Kris Carr.  She's got tons of great sounding recipies and quite a few are for juicing. It also has a list foods with the most pesticides and with the least... I picked up a few things that will be easy on the stomach just in case I'm not feeling so hot.. Just going to play it day to day. Seems like everyone is doing ok today, hopefully we will all have more good days than bad ones. Politicomama- txjunebug is right, you're neighbor could use a slap for asking such a thing.  May we all get through this week with as minimal SE as possible. Let's kick cancer in the ass. Posts.Title: Starting chemo November 2012 michellej1980 IamNancy

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2012 03:29PM JeniferMiya wrote: Hi Michelle, I had a BMX with TE done on the 25th.. Don't let the drain part worry you. I had two but many of the women I've read about have 3 and 4... The drains don't hurt, they are annoying more than anything.  If you look under Surgeries before during and after, there are lots of helpful tips... For the shower you can use a lanyard to clip the drains (that's what I did) it makes it easier.  The first week I did get help from family. An electric toothbrush is a good idea.  Keeping the soap dispenser closer to you rather than reaching for it is good. I've also been doing "wall crawls" walking my hand up the wall to maintain range of motion.. If you have any other questions, ask away.  I've been reading the October Surgeries section since that's when I had mine.  Everyone has been very helpful on this site.  I don't know what I'd do with out everyone here!! Jenifer

Posts.Content: Oct 11, 2012 12:38AM JeniferMiya wrote: Hello Ladies,  I am new here and can't begin to tell you all how grateful I am for these forums!  There is no way anyone one of us should ever feel alone with such an amazing group of women here.   I too am scheduled for a bi-lateral mastectomy plus TE on Oct. 25.  I've heard different time frames for stays in the hospital.  Some say 1-2 days others say longer.  What have any of your experiences been?.. Like everyone else, I'm worried about the level of pain I will be in but I'm sure I'll be fine.. I've also been told that I won't be able to use the bathroom w/o someone else having to wipe me.  Is this correct? (sorry for being so blunt) Picked up a pair of "silky" p.j. pants. (a quick shout out to those of you who recommended that awesome idea. High 5!) Dulcigirl, the battery op toothbrush is a great idea.  I had thought about how I was gonna brush my teeth and thought, holy hell that's probably gonna hurt.. It's now on my things to get list!  My mind is all over the place so that's all for now.  Stay positive ladies! -hugs

Posts.Content: Nov 19, 2012 07:04PM JeniferMiya wrote: Hello everyone,  It's taken a few days for me to pop back on.  I had gone for a flu shot and have done nothing but nap for a few days. I mentioned that I was going to port education on the 26th so I will update anyone who wanted to know about it... I was supposed to get a pet scan done on the 20th but insurance won't cover it so hoping to at least get a ct scan... Considering all that is going on, I've been ok with what I like to call my frankenboobs.  The part I'm having a hard time with is hair loss.. Around everyone, I act like it's no big deal and that I'll just throw on a ball cap.  But inside I'm terrified.  And being here in FL, I'm thinking it's way too warm to think of a wig.. I also wonder, do I just keep it long until I notice the change then get rid of it or do I cut it shorter.. All I can do is toss it into a bun on top of my head since I don't have full range with my arms. Thank you guys for the welcome and thank you for the link to the abreviations! May each day be better than the last.

Posts.Content: Nov 22, 2012 06:11PM JeniferMiya wrote: These down days are better with all of you here.  Wendy, my port hurts as well. Although I'm wondering if it could be the pressure from the bandages.  Last night ater waking from my nap I went into the kitchen to write down a small grocery list for my daughter to pick up.  I suddenly got the cold sweats and my kids had to practically carry me onto the couch. I almost blacked out.  Maybe due to everything going on, who knows.  At least I'm feeling better. I keep tossing around the idea of letting my daughter chop off my hair... It's so long and wavy/curly so the only thing I can do with it is put it up in a loose bun on top of my head since I don't have full range of motion with my arms.  It's been the "new do" for the past 4 weeks.  Michelle, I hate that you can relate but I'm glad you understand.  Now I don't feel so alone!

Posts.Content: Nov 26, 2012 09:36PM JeniferMiya wrote: Michelle- I hope you're feel better tomorrow.  Please know you're posts bring me a smile, as I read them in your accent! Floridamom- Maryah930 is right.. I think there are 3 of us starting tomorrow.. I'm anxious about it but I'm sure it will be fine.  I was quite shocked to see how many recliners were in the room. Posts.Title: Starting chemo November 2012 michellej1980 IamNancy

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2012 10:43PM JeniferMiya wrote: Hello Dolls!... WOW!! I've missed a ton in 2 days... I've got a horrible memory to begin with so I don't know what's going to happen with chemo brain... Mama LuvBugs- What's your address, cuz I'm on my way for some yummy meals!!!! ;p As for my "port education" all I received were forms on my treatments.. Carboplatin, Taxotere and Herceptin... Apparently I was supposed to take Dexamethasone the day before, day of and day after chemo.. This was something I wasn't aware of.. So did the chemo yesterday and everything went well but last night I noticed tons of pain in my knees.  To the point that I wasn't able to sleep, all I could do was moan (don't get too excited, it was in a bad way) After showering this morning, I noticed my upper arms and chest were hot to the touch and flushed/red.. Went back to MO for my wbc shot and ended up on an IV for an hour and a half.. feel a little better now.. Started the steroid pill and felt energetic but wearing down now.. For those of you new or starting in December, welcome sisters. I've enjoyed sharing with all of you ladies.. You're like extended family.. Cancer sucks but on a positive note, it's brought all of us together. (((hugs))) I feel the pain returning to my knees and lower back, so I'm going to wash up for bed and try to get a little sleep.. Hugs, Prayers, Positive Thoughts to each and everyone of you
Posts.Title: Starting chemo November 2012 michellej1980 IamNancy
